page.title: 01The lands of NE Kintyre
page.content: Here are combined the typical W highland features of sea hill moor farmland and natural & cultivated woodland. It supports a small community of some 58 persons, contained mainly in the village which borders the bay. Several dwellings, mainly of hill shepherds are more isolated. The area forms part of two privately-owned estates of which most residents or employees, with the exception of 1 teacher and 1 sub-postmaster, all employed persons are in the service of the estate proprietors, the only employers in the area. The work offered is mainly in farming forestry and maintainence of the private water-supply & estate property. Several estate cottages are available for let to holiday makers and attract visitors from home & abroad. The area contains the only
